get.summary: Provides a feed for telecom calls
get.description: Provides a feed for telecom calls

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The logical number of page to return, starting from 1

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: How many records to return (50 by default)

parameters.name: includeTotal
parameters.description: Whether total count should be returned

parameters.name: createdBefore
parameters.description: Return items created before certain date/time (in UTC)

parameters.name: createdOnOrAfter
parameters.description: Return items created on or after certain date/time (in UTC)

parameters.name: modifiedBefore
parameters.description: Return items modified before certain date/time (in UTC)

parameters.name: modifiedOnOrAfter
parameters.description: Return items modified on or after certain date/time (in UTC)

parameters.name: active
parameters.description:
What kind of items should be returned (only active items will be returned by default)\
Values: [True, Any, False]

parameters.name: createdAfter
parameters.description: Return items created after certain date/time (in UTC)

parameters.name: modifiedAfter
parameters.description: Return items modified after certain date/time (in UTC)

parameters.name: phoneNumberCalled
parameters.description: The phone number that was called (string)

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The Sorting field, possible values: Id, CreatedOn, ModifiedOn.
The Sorting is ascending by default, add the '-' character to use descending (for example -Id)

400.description: The request cannot be processed, check validation errors or request format

get.summary: Returns all opt-outs for the tenant
get.description: Numbers are returned in E.164 format.

400.description: The request cannot be processed, check validation errors or request format

post.summary: Adds opt-outs for the specified phone numbers
post.description:
Has to have at least one phone number in the request (use the dedicated endpoint if you need to get all the opt-outs).
All numbers in the request must be valid, otherwise the request will fail.
If a number is opted-out globally, you can't opt it out for marketing.

400.description: At least one number in the request couldn't be parsed, or there were no numbers in the request

post.summary: For each phone number in the request, returns the opt-out status, if it exists
post.description:
Has to have at least one phone number in the request (use the dedicated endpoint if you need to get all the opt-outs).
If there's no opt-out info for a phone number, it won't be included in the response.
All numbers in the request must be valid (E.164 format is preferred, but not required), otherwise the request will fail.
The numbers in the response will be in E.164 format.

400.description: At least one number in the request couldn't be parsed, or there were no numbers in the request

parameters.name: modifiedBefore
parameters.description: Modified before a certain date/time (as date-time in RFC3339), not inclusive

parameters.name: modifiedOnOrAfter
parameters.description: Modified on or after a certain date/time (as date-time in RFC3339), inclusive

parameters.name: createdOnOrAfter
parameters.description: Created on or after a certain date/time (as date-time in RFC3339), inclusive

parameters.name: modifiedAfter
parameters.description: Modified after a certain date/time (as date-time in RFC3339), not inclusive

parameters.name: phoneNumberCalled
parameters.description: The phone number that was called (string)

parameters.name: orderByDirection
parameters.description: Sorting direction (string with possible values "asc" (default) or "desc")

get.summary: Provides export feed for telecom calls
get.description: Provides export feed for telecom calls

parameters.name: from
parameters.description:
Continuation token received from previous export request in "continueFrom" field.
When not specified, the export process starts from the beginning.\
Use custom date strings, e.g. "2020-01-01" to start the export process from the certain point in time.

parameters.name: includeRecentChanges
parameters.description:
Use "true" to start receiving the most recent changes quicker.
Note this may cause the same results appearing multiple times on consecutive requests.

400.description: The request cannot be processed, check validation errors or request format

page.description: From which page this output has started

pageSize.description: Page size for this query (i.e. how many records were requested to return)

hasMore.description: True if there are more records in the query than returned in this result

totalCount.description: Total count of records for this query (can optionally be populated)

data.description: The collection of result items, will never have more than PageSize items

Telecom.V3.CallDirection.description: Indicates the direction of a call

Telecom.V3.CallType.description:
Specifies the type (classification) of the call. If null, the call was not classified yet. Also,
            outbound calls don't have classification and CallType is always null for outbound calls

type.description: A URI reference that identifies the problem type

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by server

traceId.description: Internal trace ID for advanced diagnostics

errors.description: Provides more details about errors occurred, which can potentially be used for visual display

data.description: Provides additional data, intended for programmatical usage

ApiErrorResponse.description: Detailed error response, following RFC 7807 recommendations (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807).

ActiveRequestArg.description: Represents possible HTTP query argument values, when applying filters based on active status.

contactNumbers.description: Contact numbers (must be valid parseable phone numbers, E.164 format is recommended)

Telecom.V3.GetOptOutListRequest.description: List of phone numbers to get opt-out status for

Telecom.V3.CreateOptOutResponse.description: Result of creating a single opt-out

contactNumbers.description: Contact numbers (must be valid parseable phone numbers, E.164 format is recommended)

Telecom.V3.CreateOptOutListRequest.description: List of phone numbers to create the opt-out status for

Telecom.CallDirection.description: Indicates the direction of a call.

Telecom.CallType.description: See MasterModel.CallType. It should have the same values

hasMore.description:
Indicates whether the export feed has reached its logical "end", or if there is more to export.
True means the consumer can invoke another request right away using new continuation token value.
False means there is now new data for the export, and the consumer should wait for some time (5-10 minutes)
before making another request.

continueFrom.description: Continuation token used to resume the export operation. The value should be used in "from" query parameter of the following request.

data.description: The collection of exported items, usually sorted chronologically based on modification date

status.description: The current status of the call

type.description:
The type (classification) of the call. Null if the inbound call was not classified yet or this is
            an outbound call

recordingUrl.description: The URL for call recording. Can be null if the call hasn't a recording

voiceMailPath.description:
The URL for call voicemail. Can be null if the call hasn't a voicemail. This field may have value only for
Phones Pro tenants

createdOn.description: The time the call was created (i.e. inbound call was received or outbound call was initiated)

modifiedOn.description: The last time the call properties were updated

reason.description: The info about the call reason linked to the call

customer.description: The info about the customer linked to the call

location.description: The info about the location linked to the call

campaign.description: The info about the phone advertising campaign linked to the call

job.description: The info about the job linked to the call

agent.description:
The info about the user agent who was assigned to the call. For inbound calls this is the user who
            clicked the call bubble last time, or outbound calls this is a user who initiated the call. For Phones Pro,
            this may differ to CreatedBy for outbound calls if the outbound call was transferred between users

createdBy.description: The info about the user who created the outbound call

active.description: Gets or sets whether the entity is active.

lead.description: CRM Leads created from unbooked calls

Telecom.V2.CallDirection.description: Indicates the direction of a call

Telecom.V2.CallStatus.description: Indicates the status of a call

Telecom.V2.CallType.description:
Specifies the type (classification) of the call. If null, the call was not classified yet. Also,
            outbound calls don't have classification and CallType is always null for outbound calls

number.description: Human readable number of the job

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification used by this event ("1.0").

id.description: A value that uniquely identifies this event. Consumers should assume that events with the same source and id are duplicates.

type.description: A value that identifies the type of this event ("tn.tlc.call-completed").

time.description: The date and time when this event occurred.

source.description: A URI that identifies the source of this event ("https://webhooks.servicetitan.io").

userassignedid.description: A value that identifies this event. This value is for diagnostic purposes only, and it may or may not be unique.

datacontenttype.description: The content type of the data ("application/json").

specversion.description: The version of the CloudEvents specification used by this event ("1.0").

id.description: A value that uniquely identifies this event. Consumers should assume that events with the same source and id are duplicates.

type.description: A value that identifies the type of this event ("tn.tlc.call-updated").

time.description: The date and time when this event occurred.

source.description: A URI that identifies the source of this event ("https://webhooks.servicetitan.io").

userassignedid.description: A value that identifies this event. This value is for diagnostic purposes only, and it may or may not be unique.

datacontenttype.description: The content type of the data ("application/json").
